content.content: Wow — MKR about to crack through $900 tonight. Feels like MKR token is really in a death spiral with all the other altcoins now. You can really see the timing of the decline — when we suspended the burn, we really lost all of our inverse correlation to crypto. MKR used to be seen as a safe haven when other cryptos were selling off due to our penalties + burn procedure. Hard to imagine MKR bouncing back from this one for a whole lot of years. Takes a long time to build investor confidence… and we’ve bankrupted the confidence of MKR holders.

It has more to do with the current macroeconomic outlook (a litmus test for crypto, since 2008 there has not been a crisis of this magnitude), + we are in a corrective market cycle as it has always happened after bullish cycles, it has corrected in the last 24 hours the same percentage as Eth, nothing unusual or alarming.

I think this price for MKR is a bargain, it is clearly fundermentally stronger than a year ago when it was at 6.3K, the surplus buffer is well filled with cash and 84K MKR is also in it, we will probably reactivate the burn and make an investment in ETH, the CU budget is higher but we will increase sales when we get a spread on L2 and basically draw attention to ourselves. I think we should have a vested interest in providing liquidity for MKR/ETH and MKR/DAI on dexes.
Agreed! We have a few major factors hitting the market hard. Everything is hurting. Now, we see the crypto market almost tied to the stock market which obviously is having a negative impact as well.

The key is to pay less attention to prices and more attention to the fundamentals built on this technological base, global economic problems are somewhat positive for the crypto ecosystem, as these problems tend to be solved at the expense of their national currencies, historically no currency has been able to survive real wars, remember that Bitcoin was created after a crisis as a hedge for the mistakes of others.

It’s not plecent to see all red, but fundamentals are intact. Blockchain and crypto in general came to provide real solutions to many people and Maker is a key player. This has not changed,  no reason to alarm, sooner or later the market will recover. Plus, winter purifies.

Price of MKR against ETH is hitting all time low   Very light analysis here but for what it’s worth I find no correlation between burning and MKR price historically. Doesn’t matter whether you look at USD values and USD price or burned tokens to ETH price.   It’s great to have concrete numbers to check our assumptions - thanks @adcv and @Artem_Gordon. It seems to me the burn rate would have to be incredibly high (unsustainably high) to tangibly shift MKR’s price amidst a market dominated by macro and sentiment.

Matt_NZ:  incredibly high (unsustainably high)   We are trading at double digit P/B even today. If Maker announced it would return a large part or the whole surplus buffer through a burn, it would be a very high-conviction signal that the growth expectations in the current P/B are not warranted and that there is nothing left to invest in except to return the equity to shareholders. In this instance, you could expect the price to converge near the updated long-term expected value of the token, i.e. its current book value of ca. $100 per token. This represents a -90% decline relative to today. Burning for price action assumes, without evidence, that there is inelastic demand for the token and that market cap will remain flat while supply of tokens declines ergo higher price per token. This has simply never been shown to be the case. Indeed, despite investing millions of DAI in burning historically, Maker’s token value is -85% down from ATH and all of the past burns have been a negative ROI use of capital. Our goal should be to at the very least fulfill but especially exceed the expectations for growth that are priced into the token and over time, when Maker becomes the dominant decentralized rails for financial intermediation around the world and governments start pegging their tokens to Dai rather than the other way around, we can start thinking about returning value (a lot of value) to investors. My 2gwei (of DAI).

this isnt good Maker needs spending discipline, especially in the current crypto winter! There could be a budget review process that right sizes spending given current market reality.  CUs should think carefully is they need to hire/spend more in the next 6 months, for example.

Otherwise, it seems like we will just stay the course until something big forces change.

I see that some people are worried or anxious about the MKR market price. My advice: stop looking at the graph and enjoy life. If you invested in MKR your investment is safe and its value will immensely grow after the bear market. Patience is the key.

Once the bottom arrives, I have no doubt MKR will survive the crypto winter and will build better and stronger. Rising interest rates have caused some crypto projects to become insolvent and specially affected ETH prices due to it being one of the most widely used collateral cryptos it is the first to be sold. While platforms that have become insolvent were well positioned to capture upside in bull markets they did not employ any basic risk measurements such as monitoring liquidity and collateral platform levels. Additionally, MKR is able to generate liquidation fees in downturns that can be reinvested to improve the community. DCA : time in the market is more important than timing the market
